position: Computer Vision Machine Learning Engineering Intern - Summer 2021
description:
About Canoo

If you're intrigued by the dream of working alongside the smartest & most revolutionary designers and engineers in the EV space, Canoo just may be the place for you. Are you a person who is irked by the status quo? Do you derive personal satisfaction from doing something you've never done before, and seeing that work actually put into production? Here at Canoo, every day is vastly different from the one before it, as we're moving swiftly toward our goal of changing the way the world looks at Urban Mobility. We're a well-funded start-up, led by the who's who of EV business leaders, whose passion brought them together on this special mission. We're diligently preparing for our first vehicle launch and looking for deeply experienced and passionate talent, who are not just looking for a “job," but rather are driven to raise the bar and create new benchmarks within the global EV industry. Read on...

Job Purpose

As a Computer Vision Machine Learning Engineering Intern you will assist in the development of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems. This includes developing software compliant with the Automotive Open System Architecture (AUTOSAR), collaborating with fellow employees to develop and meet requirements and creating effective documentation. Depending on previous experience and field of study, you may assist in developing diagnostics, algorithms, testing and validating software, and/or diagnostics. You can expect to be working with industry leading software tools that help optimize the workflow for the full stack of development.

This is a paid internship for Summer 2021 with an option to start on May 24, 2021 or June 21, 2021 and an option to end on August 13, 2021 or September 10, 2021.

Responsibilities

  • Train machine learning and deep learning models for object detection, classification, and image segmentation tasks
  • Develop Computer Vision algorithms including image processing, feature extraction, object detection, classification, tracking, segmentation, pose estimation, camera calibration, optical flow, stereo, and structure from motion
  • Design and implement sensor fusion algorithms
  • Analyze the performance of the perception algorithms/modules
  • Optimize the code in order to run the algorithm on embedded systems

Experience

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed Bachelor's degree (B.S./B.A.) in Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science or Aerospace Engineering
  • Solid understanding of machine learning, optimization, algorithms
  • Familiar with one of the deep learning frameworks, Tensorflow, Pytorch or MXNet
  • Expertise in state estimation, Kalman filters, statistical signal processing, machine learning
  • Excellent C/C++ programming in production environment – unit testing, code review, algorithm performance and tradeoff analysis
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Experience

  • Currently pursuing a Master's or PhD
  • Maintaining a minimum of 3.2 GPA in a 4.0 grade scale
  • Previous experience in the automotive industry

What's cool about our internship program…

  • Work with some of the most innovative minds in EV
  • Work closely with leaders working on LIVE projects in the EV industry
  • Build long lasting relationships in a high-growth start up that will redefine urban mobility
  • Take a big step towards your future career
  • Lots of team-building and networking opportunities (even remotely)
  • All Internships are PAID internships

Canoo is an equal opportunity-affirmative action employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, past or present military service or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

We are now looking for Research Interns in Robotics.
      
      NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI - the next era of computing - with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as "the AI computing company." We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Would you like to join us at the forefront of technological advancement?
      
      Intelligent machines powered by Artificial Intelligence computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Today, a self-driving car powered by AI can meander through a country road at night and find its way. An AI-powered robot can build 3D maps of its environment, detect and track real-life objects, learn from simulated environments, and understand commands. This is truly an extraordinary time - the era of AI has begun. NVIDIA is searching for world-class research Interns to join our Robotics Research Lab in Seattle, Washington. We are passionate about enabling robots to reach human-level dexterity, perception, and adaptability. We are a diverse and interdisciplinary team to work on core robotics topics ranging from control and perception to task planning and critical areas related to deep learning, computer vision, and natural language processing.
      
      Do you agree with us that the most interesting thing about this revolution is building robots to take on real-life problems? If so, our team will be an excellent fit for you. During your internship, you'll work closely with our research team to apply your experience and knowledge in areas of robotics perception, control, and learning to exciting robotics problems. This position offers you the opportunity to have real impact while working with some of the most creative and brilliant people in the world who are here at this dynamic, technology-focused company.
      
      **What we need to see:**
      
      * Pursuing a PhD (strongly preferred) or Masters in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related discipline
      
      * You have shown expertise in theory and practice of robotics with a strong interest in connecting your work to robotics scenarios
      
      * Strong background in research with publications from top robotics and AI conferences (i.e. RSS, ICRA, CVPR, NIPS)
      
      * Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative environment
      
      * Programming experience and proficiency in Python, MATLAB, C, and C++
      
      **Ways to stand out from the crowd:**
      
      * Expertise in one or more of the following: robot manipulation, robot control and reinforcement learning
      
      * Experience and/or theoretical knowledge in computer vision, human-robot-interactions, and Artificial Intelligence
      
      * Familiarity with physics-based simulation and natural language processing
      
      * Experience with CUDA and deep learning frameworks (i.e TensorFlow or Torch)
      
      NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.
      
      #deeplearning

Spring 2021 Applications Engineering Intern
2003752

Description

 

Here at ON Semiconductor we take great pride in our internship program and the efforts we take to provide students with hands-on industry experience. We provide competitive pay, medical benefits, various networking event opportunities, and flexible hours based on school schedule. 

ON Semiconductor is seeking a self-driven and motivated student to join their power integrated module team, located in Phoenix, Arizona.  As an intern application engineer, you will have the opportunity of evaluating, testing and modeling new PIM products. PIM application examples are solar inverter, energy storage, EV charger.

This opportunity will ask a student to have the following performance objectives:

  • Develop thermal evaluation system of power electronics system (for example a solar inverter with heatsink).
  • Build thermal and magnetic model of power electronics system.
  • Evaluate dynamic performance of semiconductor device.
 

Qualifications

 

In order to be considered for an internship, you must be a student currently enrolled in school pursuing an accredited degree program. This position is specifically looking for aMS/Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering.

  • Experience with advanced silicon IGBT technologies, wide bandgap devices (SiC), and their applications.
  • Proficiency in multiphysics FEA simulation software (ANSYS).
  • Hands on experience with lab testing equipment (oscilloscope, TI C2000 DSP, power supply).
  • Feel comfortable work with test voltage level up to 1200V, current up to 800A.
  • Familiar with schematic capture, PCB layout. 
  • Record of first author publication.
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills.
  • MS/Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, focus on power electronics.

ON Semiconductor (Nasdaq: ON) is driving energy efficient innovations, empowering customers to reduce global energy use. The company is a leading supplier of semiconductor-based solutions, offering a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient power and signal management, logic, standard and custom devices. The company’s products help engineers solve their unique design challenges in automotive, communications, computing, consumer, industrial, medical and military/aerospace applications. ON Semiconductor operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.

Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Our mission is to transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste. The industry is huge and so is the opportunity to change the way freight moves.

The next time you’re out driving and see an 18-wheeler on the road, that truck is empty 35% of the time. When big trucks drive empty, they throw unnecessary CO2 into the atmosphere. In fact, empty trucks generate more than 76 million metric tons of wasted carbon emissions every year. At Convoy, our digital freight network helps reduce those empty miles and cut carbon waste by nearly half.

This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help move the world forward.

About you:

Convoy is building a team of diverse, talented, and creative engineers to automate the logistics industry. We’re developing cutting-edge software that makes trucking more efficient and sustainable, all while providing a world-class shipper and carrier experience. We’re looking for people who pride themselves on their ability to create innovative products, balancing urgency with intentionality. You approach every problem, process, and system with a collaborative, open mind and are eager to continue growing your skillset.

position: Sustainable Ag Soil Informatics Solutions Intern - 3 Month (Johnston, IA)
description:
Description


Corteva Agriscience seeks a student for a full-time internship within our global Data Science and Informatics group working on soil informatics product development for applications in sustainable agriculture. We are aggressively building digital soil information capability to support Corteva’s mission to increase the resilience of our global food system.


This role will work among a team of soil science, data science, engineering, and digital solutions experts to enable sustainable decision support solutions focused on soil, water, and climate. The intern should be familiar with soil landscape and environmental data, machine learning and deep learning-based approaches, and some capability with implementing these on large geospatial datasets in Linux and cloud-based environments.


Responsibilities - What You'll Do:


+ Develop digital soil information and models.

+ Hands-on integration of various data and sensor components including data clean up, alignment, normalization and ETL pipeline development.

+ Evolve and deploy our core machine learning/deep learning algorithms to enable highly optimized models to be delivered to our research customers.

+ Applied testing and validation of developed compute solutions under field conditions while documenting learnings for further tooling development.


Qualifications


Qualifications - What You'll Bring:


+ Currently enrolled in a graduate education program pursuing (or planning to pursue) a Ph.D. or M.S. in Soil Science, Environmental Science, Civil/Geotechnical Engineering, or related scientific discipline. Ideal candidate must have completed graduate level coursework in geographic information systems, pedometrics, statistics, and machine learning.

+ Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


Preferred Qualifications:


+ Programming skills in Python or R in linux environments

+ Familiarity with open source geospatial tools including Qgis, GeoPandas, Rasterio and GDAL

+ Understanding of soil functional and biological processes

+ Interest in learning new technologies, latest ML algorithms, and scalable programming techniques.

+ Excellent interpersonal skills and a can-do attitude with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment. Experience in research, life sciences, or in data science is a plus.

+ Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work as part of a global team and, at times, independently while appropriately prioritizing tasks.

+ Strong verbal and written communication skills in English are required.


Nice-to-have:


+ Deep understanding of data processing and analysis algorithms.

+ Exposure to remote sensing or hydrological models.
Corteva Agriscience ™, the world's first dedicated agriculture start-up, serves to enrich the lives of those who produce and those who consume, ensuring progress for generations to come. Our employees fulfill this purpose everyday by building/participating in an inclusive culture where we encourage each other to stay curious, think differently, act boldly and do what's right for our customers, our co-workers, our partners and our planet. With over 20,000 team members from 130 countries, innovating in 140 world class R&D facilities, we have the resources, leadership heritage and partner ecosystem to make a meaningful impact now and into the future.
#GrowWhatMatters
Corteva Agriscience, the agriculture division of DowDuPont, is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit:
Accessibility Page for Contact Information
For US Applicants: See the 'Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law' poster
For our U.S. Affirmative Action Policy, click here

Who Are We:

We're building a modern commerce suite for messaging.  An all-in-one solution that allows our brands to talk and transact with their customers in the same place.

Whym.tech

Who Are You:

The best fit for this internship is a college Senior or MBA student majoring in some combination of the following: sales, marketing, advertising, sales strategy, business and/or entrepreneurship.

You're interested in start-ups, software, and technology.

Must be eligible to receive college credit—no exceptions.  Open to a remote employee - our team is currently WFH.

You are:

  • Self-starter with a positive attitude who is already doing great things and ready for the next challenge
  • Very confident communication skills
  • Have stellar (and positive) verbal and written communication
  • Comfortable making cold calls
  • Confident in your ideas and opinions, willing to share and learn
  • High energy
  • Outgoing personality and easy to have conversations with
  • Assertive personality, persistent, and a great listener
  • Ambition for a career in Tech sales

What You'll Work On:

  • You'll work directly with our Founder and CEO to develop and manage our sales pipeline
  • The majority of your time will be spent developing and defining the prospect list and reaching out to ideal merchants
  • Respond to inbound inquiries
  • Manage sales pipeline / tracker
  • Schedule sales calls for Founder
  • Make outreach calls to businesses and explore how our software can work for their business
  • Participate in sales calls with founder, take notes and prepare follow up materials
  • Perform industry research and competitive analysis
  •  Create marketing materials to support business development initiatives
  • Learn and support backend sales, operation and customer support systems 
  • Support team with and perform a variety of administrative tasks
  • Assist with other projects as needed
  • Blog writing skills a plus (but not required)
  • Something specific you're interested in?  Let us know!  

Commitment:

  • These are unpaid semester internships that require a 15-20 hr/week commitment.

Potential for this role to turn into a paid SDR position in the future.

Founded in 1966, SRI’s Artificial Intelligence Center (www.sri.com/about/organization/information-computing-sciences/aic) has been a pioneer and a major contributor to the field of AI. The Center researches the computational principles underlying intelligence in man and machines, and develops methods for building systems to solve problems, to communicate with people, and to perceive and interact with the physical world. Activities cover most major areas of AI, including knowledge representation and automated reasoning, machine learning and analytics, multi-agent systems, robotics, dialog-based systems, and image understanding.

Internship opportunity to work within the Artificial Intelligence Center at SRI at the office in San Diego, CA. Candidate projects span a range of topics in Natural Language Processing, Text Analytics, and Machine Learning. The internship will involve working closely with SRI staff on a current research project, providing hands-on exposure to state-of-the-art techniques and an opportunity to publish.

position: Summer 2021 - Customer Technology; Energy Cloud Intern (Newark, NJ, US)
description:
Requisition ID:  65329 

Job Function/Category:  University Recruiting 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Part Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy.

PSEG is seeking a Customer Technology Intern. The Customer Technology team implements system enhancements to customer-facing technologies such as web self-service, mobile web, My Alerts, Storm Center mobile app, and CRM. Work will vary based on the status of projects that are in motion during that time. Possible assignments include assisting team members with testing system enhancements or changes, researching and benchmarking other companies' use of similar technologies, writing user stories, and conducting web usability studies. Interns may be asked to run reports and communicate the results.

Candidates need to be able to meet deadlines, work collaboratively across the business, juggle competing priorities, operate independently while knowing when to ask for help or guidance, and view all work from a customer's perspective. Candidates should have an interest in, and comfort with, website design, e-commerce, and mobile technology. Being technically savvy is an advantage. Strong communication skills are critical, particularly written communication, and candidates with direct customer service experience are desired. Candidates should have proficiency in Microsoft Office products such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.

Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Business, Communications, CIS or related major and an anticipated graduation date between December 2021and May 2022. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions We are targetin Currently enrolled studentsstaying in the NJ/NY/PA metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration support will not be provided in association with these positions.

As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

This site (http://www.pseg.com) is strictly for candidates who are not currently PSEG employees. PSEG employees must apply for jobs internally through empower which can be accessed through the mypseg homepage by clicking on the employee center tab, then under the empower header, choose careers.

Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process.

Certain positions at the Company may require you to have access to Part 810-Controlled Information.  Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information.  Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made.  If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

# 93223 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States


At Colgate-Palmolive Company, we offer an exceptional internship program within the Global Information Technology Department. The Cloud Internship for Colgate-Palmolive is a six-month paid internship, with the opportunity to extend.


As a part of our Cloud Team team, you will:


+ Participate in projects utilizing major cloud hyperscalers. These projects include: cloud migration, data analytics, connected health as well as other cloud native projects.

+ Perform 1st level support and problem solving for these projects including: providing access, cloud security, budget assignment and other duties.

+ Work with a mentor and be a part of a team that is at the forefront of cloud technology


Who Are You?


+ You are a collaborator- In this role, Interns get opportunities to network with multiple cross-functional teams. These relationships thrive on mutual trust and integrity to achieve deliverables and execute against the strategy and goals.

+ You are an innovator- You look for opportunities to improve and seek creative solutions and you’re able to adapt and adjust the strategy and direction of your work if necessary.

+ You are curious- You’re curious about what works and what does not and are willing to take the initiative to find out.


What You’ll Need


+ A minimum GPA of 2.8

+ Must be currently enrolled in bachelor’s or graduate program at a college or university

+ Pursuing a major in: Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Business/IT Systems Management or related fields.

+ Authorized to work in the U.S. without requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future.

+ Flexible schedule, available a minimum of 15-20 hours per week

+ Technical knowledge and skills, completed course work, projects, or relevant work related experience

+ Familiarity with programming languages and web-related technologies


Equal Opportunity Employer

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

position: 2021 Summer Intern Program – Oracle Cloud Business Analyst
description:
At Servco, we’re committed to providing valuable mobility solutions to empower people through the freedom of movement and opportunity. From Australia to California, and of course, Hawaii, Team Servco is a collective of over 2,000 like-minded individuals guided by our four Core Values of Respect, Service, Teamwork, and Innovation. For over 100 years, we have been dedicated to superior service, to both our customers and team members. We look forward to helping you create Life:Moments that matter to you.

 

Servco’s internship program is an opportunity for top students to gain relevant work experience in various areas. Internship positions are only available in Hawaii. The program offers interns challenging and meaningful work that allows them to demonstrate their abilities, apply knowledge acquired through college courses, and be evaluated for possible future employment opportunities within Servco. Our internships create opportunities for interns to establish important relationships with experienced professionals.

 

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) internship program which spans over a period of 8 weeks.

 

The Oracle Cloud Business Analyst Intern will provide support in the development and implementation of process improvement efforts using technology to improve efficiency that leads to productivity gains, cost reduction and systems optimization throughout the automotive distribution organization. The intern will provide production support for all business units for Oracle related functional issues.


Responsibilities:

  • Participates in a structured learning program covering Servco as an organization and their respective business area
  • Understand functionality of implemented systems to maximize utilization
  • Work with Functional Business Analysts to review, assess and test new functionality
  • Work with automated testing tool to help test these changes
  • Assist in organizing/coordinating demonstrations, training, testing, implementation and communication of all approved system changes and the business process
  • Assist in creating ad-hoc reports using the reporting/BI tools and leverage the reports to measure/analyze key performance metrics
  • Partner with internal resources to assist in change management initiatives
  • Work with Oracle to coordinate and resolve all functional system related issues
  • Gains exposure to different career opportunities and the corporate environment through meaningful and increasingly responsible work and/or defined project assignments
  • Performs clerical functions as assigned to assist department with various projects
  • Fulfils various program requirements, makes presentations, and/or participates in additional developmental and skill building opportunities
  • Performs other duties as assigned

Requirements:                                  

  • Currently enrolled in or graduated within the last 6 months from a college/university program
  • Pursuing a degree in Business Management or Management Information Systems (or related field)
  • Ability to work with business end users to understand and document functional issues and assist in their resolution
  • Ability to understand existing business processes and propose improvements
  • Ability to learn industry-specific practices and requirements
  • Ability to apply innovations in technology to business processes
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office
  • Basic understanding of relational databases
  • Basic understanding of Oracle Cloud concepts.
  • Analytic thinker who’s skilled at problem solving and critical thinking
  • Hard working with internal motivation to research and learn new concepts and technologies
  • Previous experience with volunteer work, school/student activities, leadership roles, etc.
  • Computer literate and proficient with Microsoft applications
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Must be able to meet deadlines and handle multiple priorities
  • Ability to take direction, work with minimal supervision, and complete tasks as assigned

 

Interested?

Visit www.servco.com/careers to apply online or email us at careers@servco.com.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug-Free Workplace

position: IT Application Configuration Intern-Summer 2021 (Akron, OH, US, 44320)
description:
FirstEnergy at a Glance

We are a forward-thinking electric utility powered by a diverse team of employees committed to making customers’ lives brighter, the environment better and our communities stronger.
 

FirstEnergy (NYSE: FE) is dedicated to safety, reliability and operational excellence. Headquartered in Akron, Ohio, FirstEnergy includes one of the nation's largest investor-owned electric systems, more than 24,500 miles of transmission lines that connect the Midwest and Mid-Atlantic regions, and a regulated generating fleet with a total capacity of 3,780 megawatts.


About the Opportunity

This is an open position with FirstEnergy Service Company a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp [SC00].

 

About the Opportunity

As a participant in the Co-op/Intern Professional Development Program, you will be cultivating professional skills and perform professional level work at FirstEnergy. Each participant will receive on-the-job training, and challenging assignments to refine skills and round out competencies.

 

The Application Configuration Analyst is critical to the successful use of the technology and software systems used by FirstEnergy. The analyst in this critical role must configure, fully utilize and secure applications and understand how the FirstEnergy interface with other applications.  In addition, they provide operational to keep the system up and running.  An Application Configuration Analyst has a passion for technology and enjoys the challenge of digging in to determine how systems work and troubleshoot any issues.  The Application Configuration Analyst also learns the complex business processes of the systems they support.  They have great communication skills allowing collaboration between IT and the business unitl utlizing the appication. .

 

Resume Requirements:

Please include your Major/Minor/Degree, GPA and anticipated graduation date on your resume. Resumes that do not include Major/Minor/Degree, GPA and anticipated graduation date will not be considered.

 

Resume Suggestions:

We encourage you to include on your resume courses completed relevant to the position you're applying. Additionally, tell us about school projects where you utilized the skills needed for the position in which you are applying. Technology enthusiasts: be sure to describe your tech hobbies and use of technology outside of the classroom on your resume.

 

Examples of possible job duties and responsibilities:

• Supporting the application architecture

  • Ensuring that the application server processes continue to run and operate in the most efficient manner possible

  • Properly control and maintain security of the application according to FE standards

  • Understand system interface design & data flows to support complex inbound and outbound interfaces (both internal & external)

  • Perform software installation and patching, as needed, based on application roadmaps and issue resolution

  • Collaborate with software vendors on issue identification/resolution, installation, and patching

  • Identify opportunities to automate processes required to maintain platform performance and availability

  • Develop and enhance scripts to support production processes and operations

  • Troubleshoot applications and systems for root-cause analysis

• Supporting and improving business processes

  • Create and maintain system documentation and procedures to ensure governance and standards

  • Be an active participant in a collaborative work environment gathering requirements from business stakeholders

  • Analyzing requirements, documentation, use cases and workflow

  • Consulting with business partners in order to refine requirements and explain tradeoffs between usability and performance

  • Assist in defect resolution during testing of applications

• Provide insight into application data

  • Develop data queries and reporting solutions to meet customer requirements

  • Understand the structure and design of the application’s database

  • Provide data analysis and reports based on the needs of the business users

 

Requirements

• Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program at an accredited university/college with a major in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or technology equivalent degree.

• Must have a graduation date no earlier than May 2023 (Graduation date MUST be listed on resume)

• Maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5. (GPA date MUST be listed on resume)

• Must have the ability to work without sponsorship (now or in the future)

• Analytical skills to resolve problems and think creatively

• Highly motivated to work independently and productively and learn quickly

• Must be organized and work well with constant priority changes

• Proven team player, contributes to team goals, encourages, and supports team members

• Strong attention to detail

• Willingness to undertake assignments involving unfamiliar subjects
